content: In CSV format, create a table detailing the life cycle stages of a butterfly. Each row should represent a stage (egg, caterpillar, pupa, adult) and columns should describe duration of the stage, physical characteristics, behavior, and dietary habits.

Sure! Here's a table in CSV format detailing the life cycle stages of a butterfly:

```
Stage, Duration, Physical Characteristics, Behavior, Dietary Habits
Egg, 3-7 days, Small, round or oval, often with ridges; color varies, Attached to host plant, No movement, No feeding
Caterpillar (Larva), 2-4 weeks, Soft-bodied, segmented, often hairy or spiky; color varies, Moves to feed, Eats leaves of host plant
Pupa (Chrysalis), 1-2 weeks, Hardened exterior, often hanging from a silk pad, No movement, Metamorphosis occurs inside, No feeding
Adult Butterfly, 2-4 weeks, Wingspan varies, often colorful with patterns; long, thin body, Flies to find mates and nectar sources, Feeds on nectar from flowers
```

This table outlines the four main stages of a butterfly's life cycle, providing information on the duration, physical appearance, behavior, and dietary habits at each stage.
